sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"比赛，竞争"之意。
means: competition ： 多指体育运动中的各项比赛、角逐，也指知识、技巧等方面的竞赛。
contest ： 多指在音乐、书法、演讲等方面所进行的比赛或竞争。其结果，由评判委员会裁决。
match ： 通常指体育运动项目的比赛，隐含势均力敌意味。

word_mean: 竞争：两种结构相似的分子为与第三种分子上的一个结合部位结合而互相竞争、排斥的现象。见inhibition项下的competitive inhibition
同种或不同种生物因争夺食物、空间等资源而发生的负面影响。分为种内竞争和种间竞争两种。

sentence.Network_en: Malvolio becomes, in default of competition, the play's moral centre.
sentence.Network_cn: 因为没有与其竞争者，马伏里奥自然成了该剧的道德核心。

sentence.Network_en: The very notion of price competition is foreign to many schools.
sentence.Network_cn: 价格竞争这个概念对于许多学校都很陌生。

sentence.Network_en: Moreau took gold in the five-kilometre individual pursuit competition.
sentence.Network_cn: 莫罗在个人五公里追逐赛中获得金牌。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 3、竞争（competition）：淘宝涉及各行各业，竞争激烈。要想胜出那么我们需要分析竞争对手，我们首先要知道对手谁，寻找到与自己相.
初中英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... compare vt. 比较，对照 competition n. 比赛，竞赛 complete a. 完成的.
草莓网5折男士香水 - 全球免运费 ... 古巴绿色 Cuba Green 竞赛 Competition 古巴灰色 Cuba Grey.
第三个能力是搞懂竞争对手（Competition），职场工作者想要把工作搞好，必须要知己知彼，才能百战百胜，所以了解竞争公司或商 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from late Latin competitio(n-) 'rivalry', from competere 'strive for' (see compete)

entry.def: Competition is a situation in which two or more people or groups are trying to get something which not everyone can have.

example.ex: There's been some fierce competition for the title...
example.tran: 夺冠之争一直都相当激烈。

example.ex: It was in these studios that young painters found the support and stimulating competition of peers.
example.tran: 就是在这些画室里，年轻的画家们得到了同龄人的支持，也感受到了激励大家向前的竞争。

entry.def: The competition is the person or people you are competing with.

example.ex: I have to change my approach, the competition is too good now.
example.tran: 我得改变方法，现在的竞争对手太强。

entry.def: Competition is an activity involving two or more firms, in which each firm tries to get people to buy its own goods in preference to the other firms' goods.

example.ex: The deal would have reduced competition in the commuter-aircraft market...
example.tran: 这项协议原本会减少通勤航班市场的竞争。

example.ex: The farmers have been seeking higher prices as better protection from foreign competition...
example.tran: 农场主们一直在寻找更高的价格，以更好地保护自己不受国外竞争对手的影响。

entry.def: The competition is the goods that a rival organization is selling.

example.ex: The American aerospace industry has been challenged by some stiff competition.
example.tran: 美国航空和航天工业已经受到某种强劲的竞争产品的挑战。

entry.def: A competition is an event in which many people take part in order to find out who is best at a particular activity.

example.ex: The council has organised a series of events and competitions for school children in the area...
example.tran: 委员会为本地区的中小学生组织了一系列的活动和比赛。

means.word_mean: 1. a business relation in which two parties compete to gain customers;

sentences.sentence: "business competition can be fiendish at times"

means.word_mean: 2. an occasion on which a winner is selected from among two or more contestants
3. the act of competing as for profit or a prize;

sentences.sentence: "the teams were in fierce contention for first place"

means.word_mean: 4. the contestant you hope to defeat;

sentences.sentence: "he wanted to know what the competition was doing"

stems_affixes.word_buile: centri=centr中心+pet追+al……的→追求中心的→向心的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有能力的,能胜任的;足够的
竞争的;好竞争的;[价格等的]有竞争力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compete[v.比赛,竞争]+itive……的→adj.竞争的;好竞争的;[价格等的]有竞争力的
per全部永久+pet追求,寻求+ual……的→追求永久的
pet追求,寻求+ulant多……的→追求太多,导致脾气不好
pro前+piti=pet追求,寻求+ous……的→在[别人]前面追到→幸运的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 食欲,胃口;欲望,性欲;爱好,趣味
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap一再+pet追求,寻求+ite表名词→一再追求→有胃口
appet=appetite胃口+izer东西→n.开胃食品,开胃物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 能力,胜任某种工作的资格
stems_affixes.word_buile: competent[[adj.有能力的,能胜任的;足够的]]省鷑.能力,胜任某种工作的资格
compete[v.比赛,竞争]+ition表名词→n.竞争, 竞赛
pet追求,寻求+ition表名词→追寻状态→请愿[词性变化:可做动词]
petition[n.请愿书,申请书 v.[向…]请愿,正式请求]+er人→n.请愿人
per全部,永久+pet追求,寻求+uate=ate表动词→追求永久
pet追求,寻求+ition表名词→追寻状态→请愿[词性变化:可做动词]
pro前+piti=pet追求,寻求+ate表动词→追到前面去→获宠爱

Sentence.sentence: But the 1980s brought new competition from Japanese film company Fuji Photo, which undermined Kodak by offering lower prices for film and photo supplies.
The danger is that although some rules need to be updated to protect consumers from harm, existing rental businesses will try to destroy competition
Not only is the competition getting more intense, the application process today is also totally different from what baby boomers knew.
For more than two decades, starting in the 1960s, the poet Ted Hughes sat on the judging panel of an annual poetry competition for British schoolchildren
Ted Hughes discovered many long poems submitted for poetry competition were composed on computers.

sentences.cn: 下个星期有一场国际象棋比赛。

sentences.en: There is keen competition between the two motorcar firms.
sentences.cn: 两家汽车公司之间存在着激烈的竞争。
